summary.long: Deuteronomy is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: These are the words that Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan—in the wilderness, on the plain opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (By the way of Mount Seir it takes eleven days to reach Kadesh-barnea from Horeb.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses spoke to the Israelites just as the Lord had commanded him to speak to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was after he had defeated King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth in Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beyond the Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses undertook to expound this law as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying, ‘You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resume your journey, and go into the hill country of the Amorites as well as into the neighboring regions—the Arabah, the hill country, the Shephelah, the Negeb, and the seacoast—the land of the Canaanites and the Lebanon, as far as the great river, the River Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have set the land before you; go in and take possession of the land that the Lord swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give to them and to their descendants after them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time I said to you, ‘I am unable by myself to bear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God has multiplied you, so that today you are as numerous as the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord, the God of your ancestors, increase you a thousand times more and bless you, as he has promised you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how can I bear the heavy burden of your disputes all by myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose for each of your tribes individuals who are wise, discerning, and reputable, and I will make them your leaders.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You answered me, ‘The plan you have proposed is a good one.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the leaders of your tribes, wise and reputable individuals, and installed them as leaders over you, commanders of thousands, commanders of hundreds, commanders of fifties, commanders of tens, and officials, throughout your tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charged your judges at that time: ‘Give the members of your community a fair hearing and judge rightly between one person and another, whether kin or resident alien.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not be partial in judging: hear out the small and the great alike; you shall not be intimidated by anyone, for the judgment is God’s. Any case that is too hard for you, bring to me, and I will hear it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I charged you at that time with all the things that you should do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then, just as the Lord our God had ordered us, we set out from Horeb and went through all that great and terrible wilderness that you saw, on the way to the hill country of the Amorites, until we reached Kadesh-barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to you, ‘You have reached the hill country of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is giving us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the Lord your God has given the land to you; go up, take possession, as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has promised you; do not fear or be dismayed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All of you came to me and said, ‘Let us send men ahead of us to explore the land for us and bring back a report to us regarding the route by which we should go up and the cities we will come to.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The plan seemed good to me, and I selected twelve of you, one from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out and went up into the hill country, and when they reached the Wadi Eshcol they spied it out
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gathered some of the land’s produce, which they brought down to us. They brought back a report to us and said, ‘It is a good land that the Lord our God is giving us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you were unwilling to go up. You rebelled against the command of the Lord your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you grumbled in your tents and said, ‘It is because the Lord hates us that he has brought us out of the land of Egypt, to hand us over to the Amorites to destroy us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where are we headed? Our kindred have made our hearts melt by reporting, “The people are stronger and taller than we; the cities are large and fortified up to heaven! We actually saw there the offspring of the Anakim!” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to you, ‘Have no dread or fear of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God, who goes before you, is the one who will fight for you, just as he did for you in Egypt before your very eyes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the wilderness, where you saw how the Lord your God carried you, just as one carries a child, all the way that you traveled until you reached this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in spite of this, you have no trust in the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who goes before you on the way to seek out a place for you to camp, in fire by night, and in the cloud by day, to show you the route you should take.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord heard your words, he was wrathful and swore,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Not one of these—not one of this evil generation—shall see the good land that I swore to give to your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Caleb son of Jephunneh. He shall see it, and to him and to his descendants I will give the land on which he set foot, because of his complete fidelity to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even with me the Lord was angry on your account, saying, ‘You also shall not enter there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua son of Nun, your assistant, shall enter there; encourage him, for he is the one who will secure Israel’s possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for your little ones who you thought would become plunder, your children who today do not yet know right from wrong, they shall enter there; to them I will give it, and they shall take possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, journey back into the wilderness, in the direction of the Red Sea.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You answered me, ‘We have sinned against the Lord! We are ready to go up and fight, just as the Lord our God commanded us.’ So all of you strapped on your battle gear and thought it easy to go up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘Say to them: “Do not go up, and do not fight, for I am not in the midst of you; otherwise you will be defeated by your enemies.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although I told you, you would not listen. You rebelled against the command of the Lord and presumptuously went up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amorites who lived in that hill country then came out against you and chased you as bees do. They beat you down in Seir as far as Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you returned and wept before the Lord, the Lord would neither heed your voice nor pay you any attention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After you had stayed at Kadesh as many days as you did,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “we journeyed back into the wilderness, in the direction of the Red Sea, as the Lord had told me, and skirted Mount Seir for many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You have been skirting this hill country long enough. Head north,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and charge the people as follows: “You are about to pass through the territory of your kindred, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. They will be afraid of you, so be very careful
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to engage in battle with them, for I will not give you even so much as a foot’s length of their land, since I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall purchase food from them for money, so that you may eat, and you shall also buy water from them for money, so that you may drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the Lord your God has blessed you in all your undertakings; he knows your going through this great wilderness. These forty years the Lord your God has been with you; you have lacked nothing.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So we passed by our kin, the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, leaving behind the route of the Arabah and leaving behind Elath and Ezion-geber.
“When we had headed out along the route of the wilderness of Moab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord said to me, ‘Do not harass Moab or engage them in battle, for I will not give you any of its land as a possession, since I have given Ar as a possession to the descendants of Lot.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Emim—a large and numerous people, as tall as the Anakim—had formerly inhabited it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the Anakim, they are usually reckoned as Rephaim, though the Moabites call them Emim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Horim had formerly inhabited Seir, but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them, destroying them and settling in their place, as Israel has done in the land that the Lord gave them as a possession.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Now then, proceed to cross over the Wadi Zered.’
“So we crossed over the Wadi Zered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the length of time we had traveled from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the Wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, until the entire generation of warriors had perished from the camp, as the Lord had sworn concerning them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the Lord’s own hand was against them, to root them out from the camp, until all had perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Just as soon as all the warriors had died off from among the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord spoke to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Today you are going to cross the boundary of Moab at Ar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you approach the frontier of the Ammonites, do not harass them or engage them in battle, for I will not give the land of the Ammonites to you as a possession, because I have given it to the descendants of Lot.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It also is usually reckoned as a land of Rephaim. Rephaim formerly inhabited it, though the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a strong and numerous people, as tall as the Anakim. But the Lord destroyed them from before the Ammonites so that they could dispossess them and settle in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did the same for the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, by destroying the Horites before them so that they could dispossess them and settle in their place even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Avvim, who had lived in settlements in the vicinity of Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and settled in their place.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Proceed on your journey and cross the Wadi Arnon. See, I have handed over to you King Sihon the Amorite of Heshbon, and his land. Begin to take possession by engaging him in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day I will begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the peoples everywhere under heaven; when they hear report of you, they will tremble and be in anguish because of you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to King Sihon of Heshbon with the following terms of peace:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If you let me pass through your land, I will travel only along the road; I will turn aside neither to the right nor to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall sell me food for money, so that I may eat, and supply me water for money, so that I may drink. Only allow me to pass through on foot—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the descendants of Esau who live in Seir have done for me and likewise the Moabites who live in Ar—until I cross the Jordan into the land that the Lord our God is giving us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King Sihon of Heshbon was not willing to let us pass through, for the Lord your God had hardened his spirit and made his heart defiant in order to hand him over to you, as he has now done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord said to me, ‘See, I have begun to give Sihon and his land over to you. Begin now to take possession of his land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Sihon came out against us, he and all his people for battle at Jahaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord our God gave him over to us, and we struck him down, along with his offspring and all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time we captured all his towns, and in each town we utterly destroyed men, women, and children. We left not a single survivor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the livestock we kept as spoil for ourselves, as well as the plunder of the towns that we had captured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Aroer on the edge of the Wadi Arnon (including the town that is in the wadi itself) as far as Gilead, there was no citadel too high for us. The Lord our God gave everything to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not encroach, however, on the land of the Ammonites, avoiding the whole upper region of the Wadi Jabbok as well as the towns of the hill country, just as the Lord our God had charged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When we headed up the road to Bashan, King Og of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, for battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘Do not fear him, for I have handed him over to you, along with his people and his land. Do to him as you did to King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord our God also handed over to us King Og of Bashan and all his people. We struck him down until not a single survivor was left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time we captured all his towns; there was no citadel that we did not take from them: sixty towns, the whole region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were fortress towns with high walls, double gates, and bars, besides a great many villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we utterly destroyed them, as we had done to King Sihon of Heshbon, in each city utterly destroying men, women, and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the livestock and the plunder of the towns we kept as spoil for ourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So at that time we took from the two kings of the Amorites the land beyond the Jordan, from the Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (the Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, while the Amorites call it Senir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the towns of the tableland, the whole of Gilead, and all of Bashan, as far as Salecah and Edrei, towns of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now only King Og of Bashan was left of the remnant of the Rephaim. In fact, his bed, an iron bed, can still be seen in Rabbah of the Ammonites. By the common cubit it is nine cubits long and four cubits wide.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the land that we took possession of at that time, I gave to the Reubenites and Gadites the territory north of Aroer that is on the edge of the Wadi Arnon, as well as half the hill country of Gilead with its towns,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh the rest of Gilead and all of Bashan, Og’s kingdom. (The whole region of Argob: all that portion of Bashan used to be called a land of Rephaim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair the Manassite acquired the whole region of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and he named them—that is, Bashan—after himself, Havvoth-jair, as it is to this day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Machir I gave Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the Reubenites and the Gadites I gave the territory from Gilead as far as the Wadi Arnon, with the middle of the wadi as a boundary, and up to the Jabbok, the wadi being boundary of the Ammonites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Arabah also, with the Jordan and its banks, from Chinnereth down to the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea, with the lower slopes of Pisgah on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time, I charged you as follows: ‘Although the Lord your God has given you this land to occupy, all your troops shall cross over armed as the vanguard of your Israelite kin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only your wives, your children, and your livestock—I know that you have much livestock—shall stay behind in the towns that I have given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord gives rest to your kindred, as to you, and they also have occupied the land that the Lord your God is giving them beyond the Jordan, then each of you may return to the property that I have given to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I charged Joshua as well at that time, saying: ‘Your own eyes have seen everything that the Lord your God has done to these two kings; so the Lord will do to all the kingdoms into which you are about to cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not fear them, for it is the Lord your God who fights for you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time, too, I entreated the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘O Lord God, you have only begun to show your servant your greatness and your might. What god in heaven or on earth can perform deeds and mighty acts like yours?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me cross over to see the good land beyond the Jordan, that good hill country and the Lebanon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord was angry with me on your account and would not heed me. The Lord said to me, ‘Enough from you! Never speak to me of this matter again!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to the top of Pisgah and look around you to the west, to the north, to the south, and to the east. Look well, for you shall not cross over this Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But charge Joshua and encourage and strengthen him, because it is he who shall cross over at the head of this people and who shall secure their possession of the land that you will see.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we remained in the valley opposite Beth-peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So now, Israel, give heed to the statutes and ordinances that I am teaching you to observe, so that you may live to enter and occupy the land that the Lord, the God of your ancestors, is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must neither add anything to what I command you nor take away anything from it, but keep the commandments of the Lord your God with which I am charging you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen for yourselves what the Lord did with regard to the Baal of Peor, how the Lord your God destroyed from among you everyone who followed the Baal of Peor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while those of you who held fast to the Lord your God are all alive today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, just as the Lord my God has charged me, I now teach you statutes and ordinances for you to observe in the land that you are about to enter and occupy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must observe them and perform them, for this will show your wisdom and discernment to the peoples, who, when they hear all these statutes, will say, ‘Surely this great nation is a wise and discerning people!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what other great nation has a god so near to it as the Lord our God is whenever we call to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what other great nation has statutes and ordinances as just as this entire law that I am setting before you today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But take care and watch yourselves closely, so as neither to forget the things that your eyes have seen nor to let them slip from your mind all the days of your life; make them known to your children and your children’s children—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how you once stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, when the Lord said to me, ‘Assemble the people for me, and I will let them hear my words, so that they may learn to fear me as long as they live on the earth and may teach their children so’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you approached and stood at the foot of the mountain while the mountain was blazing up to the very heavens, shrouded in dark clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to you out of the fire. You heard the sound of words but saw no form; there was only a voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He declared to you his covenant, which he charged you to observe, that is, the ten commandments, and he wrote them on two stone tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord charged me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Since you saw no form when the Lord spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire, watch yourselves closely,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you do not act corruptly by making an idol for yourselves in the form of any figure: the likeness of male or female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you look up to the heavens and see the sun, the moon, and the stars, all the host of heaven, do not be led astray and bow down to them and serve them, things that the Lord your God has allotted to all the peoples everywhere under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord has taken you and brought you out of the iron smelter, out of Egypt, to become a people of his very own possession, as you are now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord was angry with me because of you, and he vowed that I should not cross the Jordan and that I should not enter the good land that the Lord your God is giving for your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am going to die in this land without crossing over the Jordan, but you are going to cross over to take possession of that good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be careful, lest you forget the covenant that the Lord your God made with you and make for yourselves an idol in the form of anything that the Lord your God has forbidden you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have had children and children’s children and become complacent in the land, if you act corruptly by making an idol in the form of anything, thus doing what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God and provoking him to anger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today that you will soon utterly perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to occupy; you will not live long on it but will be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will scatter you among the peoples; only a few of you will be left among the nations where the Lord will lead you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you will serve gods made by human hands, objects of wood and stone that neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there you will seek the Lord your God, and you will find him if you search after him with all your heart and soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your distress, when all these things have happened to you in time to come, you will return to the Lord your God and heed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Lord your God is a merciful God, he will neither abandon you nor destroy you; he will not forget the covenant with your ancestors that he swore to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For ask now about former ages, long before your own, ever since the day that God created human beings on the earth; ask from one end of heaven to the other: Has anything so great as this ever happened, or has its like ever been heard of?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has any people ever heard the voice of a god speaking out of a fire, as you have heard, and lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or has any god ever attempted to go and take a nation for himself from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs and wonders, by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and by terrifying displays of power, as the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you it was shown so that you would acknowledge that the Lord is God; there is no other besides him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From heaven he made you hear his voice to discipline you. On earth he showed you his great fire, while you heard his words coming out of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he loved your ancestors, he chose their descendants after them. He brought you out of Egypt with his own presence, by his great power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: driving out before you nations greater and mightier than yourselves, to bring you in, giving you their land for a possession, as it is still today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So acknowledge today and take to heart that the Lord is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath; there is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep his statutes and his commandments, which I am commanding you today for your own well-being and that of your descendants after you, so that you may long remain in the land that the Lord your God is giving you for all time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses set apart on the east side of the Jordan three cities
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to which a homicide could flee, someone who unintentionally kills another person, the two not having been at enmity before; the homicide could flee to one of these cities and live:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer in the wilderness on the tableland belonging to the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead belonging to the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan belonging to the Manassites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law that Moses set before the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the decrees and the statutes and ordinances that Moses spoke to the Israelites when they had come out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beyond the Jordan in the valley opposite Beth-peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who reigned at Heshbon, whom Moses and the Israelites defeated when they came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They occupied his land and the land of King Og of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites on the eastern side of the Jordan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Wadi Arnon, as far as Mount Sirion (that is, Hermon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: together with all the Arabah on the east side of the Jordan as far as the Sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses convened all Israel and said to them:
“Hear, O Israel, the statutes and ordinances that I am addressing to you today; you shall learn them and observe them diligently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not with our ancestors did the Lord make this covenant but with us, who are all of us here alive today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke with you face to face at the mountain, out of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (At that time I was standing between the Lord and you to declare to you the word of the Lord, for you were afraid because of the fire and did not go up the mountain.) And he said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall have no other gods before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘You shall not make for yourself an idol, whether in the form of anything that is in heaven above or that is on the earth beneath or that is in the water under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I the Lord your God am a jealous God, punishing children for the iniquity of parents to the third and fourth generation of those who reject me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing steadfast love to the thousandth generation of those who love me and keep my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘You shall not make wrongful use of the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not acquit anyone who misuses his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Observe the Sabbath day and keep it holy, as the Lord your God commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God; you shall not do any work—you, or your son or your daughter, or your male or female slave, or your ox or your donkey, or any of your livestock, or the resident alien in your towns, so that your male and female slave may rest as well as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God brought you out from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the Lord your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Honor your father and your mother, as the Lord your God commanded you, so that your days may be long and that it may go well with you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Neither shall you commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Neither shall you steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Neither shall you bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“ ‘Neither shall you covet your neighbor’s wife.
“ ‘Neither shall you desire your neighbor’s house, or field, or male or female slave, or ox, or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These words the Lord spoke with a loud voice to your whole assembly at the mountain, out of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness, and he added no more. He wrote them on two stone tablets and gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, you approached me, all the heads of your tribes and your elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you said, ‘Look, the Lord our God has shown us his glory and greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the fire. We have seen this day that God may speak to someone and the person may still live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now why should we die? For this great fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the Lord our God any longer, we shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is there of all flesh that has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the fire, as we have, and lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go near, you yourself, and hear all that the Lord our God will say. Then tell us everything that the Lord our God tells you, and we will listen and do it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord heard your words when you spoke to me, and the Lord said to me, ‘I have heard the words of this people, which they have spoken to you; they are right in all that they have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only they had such a mind as this, to fear me and to keep all my commandments always, so that it might go well with them and with their children forever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go say to them, “Return to your tents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, stand here by me, and I will tell you all the commandments, the statutes and the ordinances, that you shall teach them, so that they may do them in the land that I am giving them to possess.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must therefore be careful to do as the Lord your God has commanded you; you shall not turn to the right or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must follow exactly the path that the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live and that it may go well with you and that you may live long in the land that you are to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is the commandment—the statutes and the ordinances—that the Lord your God charged me to teach you to observe in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you and your children and your children’s children may fear the Lord your God all the days of your life and keep all his decrees and his commandments that I am commanding you, so that your days may be long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear therefore, O Israel, and observe them diligently, so that it may go well with you and so that you may multiply greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear, O Israel: The Lord is our God, the Lord alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep these words that I am commanding you today in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Recite them to your children and talk about them when you are at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bind them as a sign on your hand, fix them as an emblem on your forehead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God has brought you into the land that he swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give you—a land with fine, large cities that you did not build,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: houses filled with all sorts of goods that you did not fill, hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant—and when you have eaten your fill,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take care that you do not forget the Lord, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God you shall fear, him you shall serve, and by his name alone you shall swear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not follow other gods, any of the gods of the peoples who are all around you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Lord your God, who is present with you, is a jealous God. The anger of the Lord your God would be kindled against you and he would destroy you from the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not put the Lord your God to the test, as you tested him at Massah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must diligently keep the commandments of the Lord your God and his decrees and his statutes that he has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do what is right and good in the sight of the Lord, so that it may go well with you and so that you may go in and occupy the good land that the Lord swore to your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thrusting out all your enemies from before you, as the Lord has promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When your children ask you in time to come, ‘What is the meaning of the decrees and the statutes and the ordinances that the Lord our God has commanded you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say to your children, ‘We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt, but the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord displayed before our eyes great and awesome signs and wonders against Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought us out from there in order to bring us in, to give us the land that he promised on oath to our ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord commanded us to observe all these statutes, to fear the Lord our God, for our lasting good, so as to keep us alive, as is now the case.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we diligently observe this entire commandment before the Lord our God, as he has commanded us, we will be in the right.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God brings you into the land that you are about to enter and occupy and he clears away many nations before you—the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, seven nations more numerous and mightier than you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the Lord your God gives them over to you and you defeat them, then you must utterly destroy them. Make no covenant with them and show them no mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not intermarry with them, giving your daughters to their sons or taking their daughters for your sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that would turn away your children from following me, to serve other gods. Then the anger of the Lord would be kindled against you, and he would destroy you quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is how you must deal with them: break down their altars, smash their pillars, cut down their sacred poles, and burn their idols with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a people holy to the Lord your God; the Lord your God has chosen you out of all the peoples on earth to be his people, his treasured possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It was not because you were more numerous than any other people that the Lord set his heart on you and chose you, for you were the fewest of all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was because the Lord loved you and kept the oath that he swore to your ancestors that the Lord has brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know, therefore, that the Lord your God is God, the faithful God who maintains covenant loyalty with those who love him and keep his commandments, to a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who repays in their own person those who reject him. He does not delay but repays in their own person those who reject him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, observe diligently the commandment—the statutes and the ordinances—that I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you heed these ordinances by diligently observing them, the Lord your God will maintain with you the covenant loyalty that he swore to your ancestors;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will love you, bless you, and multiply you; he will bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your wine and your oil, the increase of your cattle and the issue of your flock, in the land that he swore to your ancestors to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be the most blessed of peoples, with neither sterility nor barrenness among you or your livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will turn away from you every illness; all the dread diseases of Egypt that you experienced, he will not inflict on you, but he will lay them on all who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall devour all the peoples that the Lord your God is giving over to you, showing them no pity; you shall not serve their gods, for that would be a snare to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you say to yourself, ‘These nations are more numerous than I; how can I dispossess them?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do not be afraid of them. Just remember what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great trials that your eyes saw, the signs and wonders, the mighty hand and the outstretched arm by which the Lord your God brought you out. The Lord your God will do the same to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord your God will send swarms of hornets against them until even the survivors and the fugitives are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have no dread of them, for the Lord your God, who is present with you, is a great and awesome God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will clear away these nations before you little by little; you will not be able to make a quick end of them, otherwise the wild animals would become too numerous for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord your God will give them over to you and throw them into great panic until they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will hand their kings over to you, and you shall blot out their name from under heaven; no one will be able to stand against you until you have destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The images of their gods you shall burn with fire. Do not covet the silver or the gold that is on them and take it for yourself, because you could be ensnared by it, for it is abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not bring an abhorrent thing into your house, or you will be set apart for destruction like it. You must utterly detest and abhor it, for it is set apart for destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The entire commandment that I command you today you must diligently observe, so that you may live and increase and go in and occupy the land that the Lord promised on oath to your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the long way that the Lord your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, in order to humble you, testing you to know what was in your heart, whether or not you would keep his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He humbled you by letting you hunger, then by feeding you with manna, with which neither you nor your ancestors were acquainted, in order to make you understand that one does not live by bread alone but by every word that comes from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clothes on your back did not wear out, and your feet did not swell these forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know, then, in your heart that, as a parent disciplines a child, so the Lord your God disciplines you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore keep the commandments of the Lord your God by walking in his ways and by fearing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is bringing you into a good land, a land with flowing streams, with springs and underground waters welling up in valleys and hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land of wheat and barley, of vines and fig trees and pomegranates, a land of olive oil and honey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land where you may eat bread without scarcity, where you will lack nothing, a land whose stones are iron and from whose hills you may mine copper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat your fill and bless the Lord your God for the good land that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take care that you do not forget the Lord your God by failing to keep his commandments, his ordinances, and his statutes that I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have eaten your fill and have built fine houses and live in them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when your herds and flocks have multiplied and your silver and gold is multiplied and all that you have is multiplied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then do not exalt yourself, forgetting the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, an arid wasteland with poisonous snakes and scorpions. He made water flow for you from flint rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fed you in the wilderness with manna that your ancestors did not know, to humble you and to test you and in the end to do you good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not say to yourself, ‘My power and the might of my own hand have gotten me this wealth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But remember the Lord your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth, so that he may confirm his covenant that he swore to your ancestors, as he is doing today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do forget the Lord your God and follow other gods to serve and worship them, I solemnly warn you today that you shall surely perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the nations that the Lord is destroying before you, so shall you perish, because you would not obey the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear, O Israel! You are about to cross the Jordan today, to go in and dispossess nations larger and mightier than you, great cities, fortified to the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a strong and tall people, the offspring of the Anakim, whom you know. You have heard it said, ‘Who can stand up to the Anakim?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know, then, today that the Lord your God is the one who crosses over before you as a devouring fire; he will defeat them and subdue them before you, so that you may dispossess and destroy them quickly, as the Lord has promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God thrusts them out before you, do not say to yourself, ‘It is because of my righteousness that the Lord has brought me in to occupy this land’; it is rather because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is dispossessing them before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not because of your righteousness or the uprightness of your heart that you are going in to occupy their land, but because of the wickedness of these nations the Lord your God is dispossessing them before you, in order to fulfill the promise that the Lord made on oath to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Know, then, that the Lord your God is not giving you this good land to occupy because of your righteousness, for you are a stubborn people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember; do not forget how you provoked the Lord your God to wrath in the wilderness; you have been rebellious against the Lord from the day you came out of the land of Egypt until you came to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even at Horeb you provoked the Lord to wrath, and the Lord was so angry with you that he was ready to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant that the Lord made with you, I remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord gave me the two stone tablets written with the finger of God; on them were all the words that the Lord had spoken to you at the mountain out of the fire on the day of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of forty days and forty nights the Lord gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘Get up; go down quickly from here, for your people whom you have brought from Egypt have acted corruptly. They have been quick to turn from the way that I commanded them; they have cast an image for themselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the Lord said to me, ‘I have seen that this people is indeed a stubborn people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me alone that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven, and I will make of you a nation mightier and more numerous than they.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I turned and went down from the mountain, while the mountain was ablaze; the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw that you had indeed sinned against the Lord your God, by casting for yourselves an image; you had been quick to turn from the way that the Lord had commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took hold of the two tablets and flung them from my two hands, smashing them before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I lay prostrate before the Lord as before, forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water because of all the sin you had committed, provoking the Lord by doing what was evil in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was afraid that the anger that the Lord bore against you was so fierce that he would destroy you. But the Lord listened to me that time also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was so angry with Aaron that he was ready to destroy him, but I interceded also on behalf of Aaron at that same time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the sinful thing you had made, the calf, and burned it with fire and crushed it, grinding it thoroughly, until it was reduced to dust, and I threw the dust into the stream that runs down the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At Taberah also, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah, you provoked the Lord to wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying, ‘Go up and occupy the land that I have given you,’ you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God, neither trusting him nor obeying him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been rebellious against the Lord as long as he has known you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Throughout the forty days and forty nights that I lay prostrate before the Lord when the Lord intended to destroy you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I prayed to the Lord and said, ‘Lord God, do not destroy your people, your very own possession, whom you redeemed in your greatness, whom you brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; pay no attention to the stubbornness of this people, their wickedness and their sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest the land from which you have brought us say, “Because the Lord was not able to bring them into the land that he promised them and because he hated them, he has brought them out to let them die in the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are your people, your very own possession, whom you brought out by your great power and by your outstretched arm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time the Lord said to me, ‘Carve out two tablets of stone like the former ones, and come up to me on the mountain, and make an ark of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will write on the tablets the words that were on the former tablets, which you smashed, and you shall put them in the ark.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I made an ark of acacia wood, cut two tablets of stone like the former ones, and went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he wrote on the tablets the same words as before, the ten commandments that the Lord had spoken to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the assembly, and the Lord gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I turned and came down from the mountain and put the tablets in the ark that I had made, and there they are, as the Lord commanded me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Israelites journeyed from Beeroth-bene-jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died, and there he was buried; his son Eleazar succeeded him as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land with flowing streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to stand before the Lord to minister to him and to bless in his name, to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Levi has no allotment or inheritance with his kindred; the Lord is his inheritance, as the Lord your God promised him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, as I had done the first time. And once again the Lord listened to me. The Lord was unwilling to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘Get up, go on your journey at the head of the people, that they may go in and occupy the land that I swore to their ancestors to give them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So now, O Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you? Only to fear the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, to love him, to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to keep the commandments of the Lord and his decrees that I am commanding you today, for your own well-being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although heaven and the heaven of heavens belong to the Lord your God, the earth with all that is in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet the Lord set his heart in love on your ancestors alone and chose you, their descendants after them, out of all the peoples, as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcise, then, the foreskin of your heart, and do not be stubborn any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great God, mighty and awesome, who is not partial and takes no bribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who executes justice for the orphan and the widow, and who loves the strangers, providing them food and clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also love the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall fear the Lord your God; him you shall serve; to him you shall hold fast; and by his name you shall swear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is your praise; he is your God who has done for you these great and awesome things that your own eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors went down to Egypt seventy persons, and now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall love the Lord your God, therefore, and keep his charge, his decrees, his ordinances, and his commandments always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember today that it was not your children (who have not known or seen the discipline of the Lord your God), but it is you who must acknowledge his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his signs and his deeds that he did in Egypt to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and to all his land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what he did to the Egyptian army, to their horses and chariots, how he made the water of the Red Sea flow over them as they pursued you, so that the Lord has destroyed them to this day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what he did to you in the wilderness until you came to this place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab son of Reuben, how in the midst of all Israel the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, along with their households, their tents, and every living being in their company;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is your own eyes that have seen every great deed that the Lord did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Keep, then, the entire commandment that I am commanding you today, so that you may have strength to go in and occupy the land that you are crossing over to occupy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so that you may live long in the land that the Lord swore to your ancestors to give them and to their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land that you are about to enter to occupy is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you sow your seed and irrigate by foot like a vegetable garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land that you are crossing over to occupy is a land of hills and valleys watered by rain from the sky,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land that the Lord your God looks after. The eyes of the Lord your God are always on it, from the beginning of the year to the end of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you will only heed his every commandment that I am commanding you today—loving the Lord your God and serving him with all your heart and with all your soul—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he will give the rain for your land in its season, the early rain and the later rain, and you will gather in your grain, your wine, and your oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will give grass in your field for your livestock, and you will eat your fill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care, or you will be seduced into turning away, serving other gods and worshiping them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for then the anger of the Lord will be kindled against you, and he will shut up the heavens, so that there will be no rain, and the land will not yield its produce; then you will perish quickly off the good land that the Lord is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall put these words of mine in your heart and soul, and you shall bind them as a sign on your hand and fix them as an emblem on your forehead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach them to your children, talking about them when you are at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you rise up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land that the Lord swore to your ancestors to give them, as long as the heavens are above the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you will diligently observe this entire commandment that I am commanding you, loving the Lord your God, walking in all his ways, and holding fast to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations larger and mightier than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every place on which you set foot shall be yours; your territory shall extend from the wilderness to the Lebanon and from the River, the River Euphrates, to the Western Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will be able to stand against you; the Lord your God will put the fear and dread of you on all the land on which you set foot, as he promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blessing, if you obey the commandments of the Lord your God that I am commanding you today;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the Lord your God but turn from the way that I am commanding you today, to follow other gods that you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God has brought you into the land that you are entering to occupy, you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you know, they are beyond the Jordan, some distance to the west, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah, opposite Gilgal, beside the oak of Moreh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you cross the Jordan to go in to occupy the land that the Lord your God is giving you and when you occupy it and live in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must diligently observe all the statutes and ordinances that I am setting before you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the statutes and ordinances that you must diligently observe in the land that the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has given you to occupy all the days that you live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must demolish completely all the places where the nations whom you are about to dispossess served their gods, on the mountain heights, on the hills, and under every leafy tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Break down their altars, smash their pillars, burn their sacred poles with fire, and cut down the idols of their gods, and thus blot out their name from their places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not serve the Lord your God in such ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall seek the place that the Lord your God will choose out of all your tribes as his habitation to put his name there. You shall go there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bringing there your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and your donations, your votive gifts, your freewill offerings, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall eat there in the presence of the Lord your God, you and your households together, rejoicing in all the undertakings in which the Lord your God has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not act as we are acting here today, all of us according to our own desires,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have not yet come into the rest and the possession that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you cross over the Jordan and live in the land that the Lord your God is allotting to you, and when he gives you rest from your enemies all around so that you live in safety,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall bring everything that I command you to the place that the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his name: your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and your donations, and all your choice votive gifts that you vow to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God, you together with your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, and the Levites who reside in your towns (since they have no allotment or inheritance with you).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take care that you do not offer your burnt offerings at any place you happen to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But only at the place that the Lord will choose in one of your tribes—there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do everything I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet whenever you desire you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your towns, according to the blessing that the Lord your God has given you; the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as they would of gazelle or deer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blood, however, you must not eat; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor may you eat within your towns the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your oil, the firstlings of your herds and your flocks, any of your votive gifts that you vow, your freewill offerings, or your donations;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these you shall eat in the presence of the Lord your God at the place that the Lord your God will choose, you together with your son and your daughter, your male and female slaves, and the Levites resident in your towns, rejoicing in the presence of the Lord your God in all your undertakings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care that you do not neglect the Levite as long as you live in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as he has promised you, and you say, ‘I am going to eat some meat,’ because you wish to eat meat, you may eat meat whenever you have the desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the place where the Lord your God will choose to put his name is too far from you, and you slaughter as I have commanded you any of your herd or flock that the Lord has given you, then you may eat within your towns whenever you desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, just as gazelle or deer is eaten, so you may eat it; the unclean and the clean alike may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only be sure that you do not eat the blood, for the blood is the life, and you shall not eat the life with the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not eat it; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, because you do what is right in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the sacred donations that are due from you and your votive gifts you shall bring to the place that the Lord will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall present your burnt offerings, both the meat and the blood, on the altar of the Lord your God; the blood of your other sacrifices shall be poured out beside the altar of the Lord your God, but the meat you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful to obey all these words that I command you, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you forever, because you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God has cut off before you the nations whom you are about to enter to dispossess them, when you have dispossessed them and live in their land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take care that you are not snared into imitating them, after they have been destroyed before you; do not inquire concerning their gods, saying, ‘How did these nations serve their gods? I also want to do the same.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not do the same for the Lord your God, because every abhorrent thing that the Lord hates they have done for their gods. They would even burn their sons and their daughters in the fire to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must diligently observe everything that I command you; do not add to it or take anything from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If prophets or those who divine by dreams appear among you and show you omens or portents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the omens or the portents declared by them take place, and they say, ‘Let us follow other gods’ (whom you have not known) ‘and let us serve them,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must not heed the words of those prophets or those who divine by dreams, for the Lord your God is testing you, to know whether you indeed love the Lord your God with all your heart and soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God you shall follow, him alone you shall fear, his commandments you shall keep, his voice you shall obey, him you shall serve, and to him you shall hold fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those prophets or those who divine by dreams shall be put to death for having spoken treason against the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery, to turn you from the way in which the Lord your God commanded you to walk. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone secretly entices you—even if it is your brother, your father’s son or your mother’s son, or your own son or daughter, or the wife you embrace, or your most intimate friend—saying, ‘Let us go serve other gods,’ whom neither you nor your ancestors have known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: any of the gods of the peoples who are around you, whether near you or far away from you, from one end of the earth to the other,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must not yield to or heed any such persons. Show them no pity or compassion, and do not shield them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall surely kill them; your own hand shall be first against them to execute them and afterward the hand of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stone them to death for trying to turn you away from the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all Israel shall hear and be afraid and never again do any such wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you hear it said about one of the towns that the Lord your God is giving you to live in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that scoundrels from among you have gone out and led the inhabitants of the town astray, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods,’ whom you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall inquire and make a thorough investigation. If the charge is established that such an abhorrent thing has been done among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall put the inhabitants of that town to the sword, utterly destroying it and everything in it, even putting its livestock to the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of its spoil you shall gather into its public square, then burn the town and all its spoil with fire as a whole burnt offering to the Lord your God. It shall remain a perpetual ruin, never to be rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anything devoted to destruction stick to your hand, so that the Lord may turn from his fierce anger and show you compassion, and in his compassion multiply you, as he swore to your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you obey the voice of the Lord your God by keeping all his commandments that I am commanding you today, doing what is right in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are children of the Lord your God. You must not lacerate yourselves or shave your forelocks for the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a people holy to the Lord your God; it is you the Lord has chosen out of all the peoples on earth to be his people, his treasured possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not eat any abhorrent thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any animal that divides the hoof and has the hoof cleft in two and chews the cud, among the animals, you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet of those that chew the cud or have the hoof cleft you shall not eat these: the camel, the hare, and the rock badger because they chew the cud but do not divide the hoof; they are unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the pig, because it divides the hoof but does not chew the cud, is unclean for you. You shall not eat their meat, and you shall not touch their carcasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of all that live in water you may eat these: whatever has fins and scales you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever does not have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You may eat any clean birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are the ones that you shall not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the osprey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the buzzard, the kite of any kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every raven of any kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, the hawk of any kind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the little owl and the great owl, the water hen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the desert owl, the carrion vulture and the cormorant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stork, the heron of any kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all winged insects are unclean for you; they shall not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat any clean winged creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall not eat anything that dies of itself; you may give it to aliens residing in your towns for them to eat, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a people holy to the Lord your God.
“You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Set apart a tithe of all the yield of your seed that is brought in yearly from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the presence of the Lord your God, in the place that he will choose as a dwelling for his name, you shall eat the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your oil, as well as the firstlings of your herd and flock, so that you may learn to fear the Lord your God always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, when the Lord your God has blessed you, the distance is so great that you are unable to transport it, because the place where the Lord your God will choose to set his name is too far away from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you may turn it into money. With the money secure in hand, go to the place that the Lord your God will choose;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: spend the money for whatever you wish: oxen, sheep, wine, strong drink, or whatever you desire. And you shall eat there in the presence of the Lord your God, you and your household rejoicing together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Levites resident in your towns, do not neglect them, because they have no allotment or inheritance with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every third year you shall bring out the full tithe of your produce for that year and store it within your towns;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Levites, because they have no allotment or inheritance with you, as well as the resident aliens, the orphans, and the widows in your towns, may come and eat their fill so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work that you undertake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every seventh year you shall grant a remission of debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the manner of the remission: every creditor shall remit the claim that is held against a neighbor, not exacting it, because the Lord’s remission has been proclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a foreigner you may exact it, but you must remit your claim on whatever any member of your community owes you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will, however, be no one in need among you, because the Lord is sure to bless you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you as a possession to occupy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if only you will obey the Lord your God by diligently observing this entire commandment that I command you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God has blessed you, as he promised you, you will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow; you will rule over many nations, but they will not rule over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If there is among you anyone in need, a member of your community in any of your towns within the land that the Lord your God is giving you, do not be hard-hearted or tight-fisted toward your needy neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should rather open your hand, willingly lending enough to meet the need, whatever it may be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that you do not entertain a mean thought, thinking, ‘The seventh year, the year of remission, is near,’ and therefore view your needy neighbor with hostility and give nothing; your neighbor might cry to the Lord against you, and you would incur guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give liberally and be ungrudging when you do so, for on this account the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in all that you undertake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since there will never cease to be some in need on the earth, I therefore command you, ‘Open your hand to the poor and needy neighbor in your land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a member of your community, whether a Hebrew man or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you and works for you six years, in the seventh year you shall set that person free.
verses.speaker: Narrator
