verses.text: And when you send a male slave out from you a free person, you shall not send him out empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Provide for him liberally out of your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress, thus giving to him some of the bounty with which the Lord your God has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God redeemed you; for this reason I lay this command upon you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he says to you, ‘I will not go out from you,’ because he loves you and your household, since he is well off with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then you shall take an awl and thrust it through his earlobe into the door, and he shall be your slave forever.
“You shall do the same with regard to your female slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not consider it a hardship when you send them out from you free persons, because for six years they have given you services worth the wages of hired laborers, and the Lord your God will bless you in all that you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every firstling male born of your herd and flock you shall consecrate to the Lord your God; you shall not do work with your firstling ox nor shear the firstling of your flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat it, you together with your household, in the presence of the Lord your God year by year at the place that the Lord will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it has any defect—any serious defect, such as lameness or blindness—you shall not sacrifice it to the Lord your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: within your towns you may eat it, the unclean and the clean alike, as you would a gazelle or deer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its blood, however, you must not eat; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Observe the month of Abib by keeping the Passover to the Lord your God, for in the month of Abib the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer the Passover sacrifice to the Lord your God from the flock and the herd, at the place that the Lord will choose as a dwelling for his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat with it anything leavened. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread with it—the bread of affliction—because you came out of the land of Egypt in great haste, so that all the days of your life you may remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No leaven shall be seen with you in all your territory for seven days, and none of the meat of what you slaughter on the evening of the first day shall remain until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not permitted to offer the Passover sacrifice within any of your towns that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at the place that the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his name, only there shall you offer the Passover sacrifice, in the evening at sunset, the time of day when you departed from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall cook it and eat it at the place that the Lord your God will choose; the next morning you may go back to your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days you shall continue to eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly for the Lord your God, when you shall do no work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall count seven weeks; begin to count the seven weeks from the time the sickle is first put to the standing grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall keep the Festival of Weeks to the Lord your God, contributing a freewill offering in proportion to the blessing that you have received from the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice before the Lord your God—you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, the Levites resident in your towns, as well as the strangers, the orphans, and the widows who are among you—at the place that the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and diligently observe these statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall keep the Festival of Booths for seven days, when you have gathered in the produce from your threshing floor and your winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice during your festival, you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, as well as the Levites, the strangers, the orphans, and the widows resident in your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days you shall keep the festival to the Lord your God at the place that the Lord will choose, for the Lord your God will bless you in all your produce and in all your undertakings, and you shall surely celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Lord your God at the place that he will choose: at the Festival of Unleavened Bread, at the Festival of Weeks, and at the Festival of Booths. They shall not appear before the Lord empty-handed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all shall give as they are able, according to the blessing of the Lord your God that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall appoint judges and officials throughout your tribes, in all your towns that the Lord your God is giving you, and they shall render just decisions for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not distort justice; you must not show partiality; and you must not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and subverts the cause of those who are in the right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Justice, and only justice, you shall pursue, so that you may live and occupy the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not plant any tree as a sacred pole beside the altar that you make for the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall you set up a stone pillar—things that the Lord your God hates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not sacrifice to the Lord your God an ox or a sheep that has a defect, anything seriously wrong, for that is abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If there is found among you, in one of your towns that the Lord your God is giving you, a man or woman who does what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God and transgresses his covenant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by going to serve other gods and worshiping them—whether the sun or the moon or any of the host of heaven, which I have forbidden—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it is reported to you or you hear of it, and you make a thorough inquiry, and the charge is proved true that such an abhorrent thing has occurred in Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall bring out to your gates that man or that woman who has committed this crime, and you shall stone the man or woman to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the evidence of two or three witnesses the death sentence shall be executed; a person must not be put to death on the evidence of only one witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first raised against the person to execute the death penalty and afterward the hands of all the people. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a judicial decision is too difficult for you to make between one kind of bloodshed and another, one kind of legal right and another, or one kind of assault and another—any such matters of dispute in your towns—then you shall immediately go up to the place that the Lord your God will choose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where you shall consult with the Levitical priests and the judge who is in office in those days; they shall announce to you the decision in the case.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carry out exactly the decision that they announce to you from the place that the Lord will choose, diligently observing everything they instruct you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must carry out the law that they interpret for you or the ruling that they announce to you; do not turn aside from the decision that they announce to you, either to the right or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for anyone who presumes to disobey the priest appointed to minister there to the Lord your God or the judge, that person shall die. So you shall purge the evil from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people will hear and be afraid and will not act presumptuously again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have come into the land that the Lord your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say, ‘I will set a king over me, like all the nations that are around me,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you may indeed set over you a king whom the Lord your God will choose. One of your own community you may set as king over you; you are not permitted to put a foreigner over you, who is not of your own community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, he must not acquire many horses for himself or return the people to Egypt in order to acquire more horses, since the Lord has said to you, ‘You must never return that way again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he must not acquire many wives for himself or else his heart will turn away; also silver and gold he must not acquire in great quantity for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has taken the throne of his kingdom, he shall write for himself a copy of this law on a scroll in the presence of the Levitical priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall remain with him, and he shall read in it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the Lord his God, diligently observing all the words of this law and these statutes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither exalting himself above other members of the community nor turning aside from the commandment, either to the right or to the left, so that he and his descendants may reign long over his kingdom in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, shall have no allotment or inheritance within Israel. They may eat the offerings by fire that are the Lord’s portion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they shall have no inheritance among the other members of the community; the Lord is their inheritance, as he promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This shall be the priests’ due from the people, from those offering a sacrifice, whether an ox or a sheep: they shall give to the priest the shoulder, the two jowls, and the stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first fruits of your grain, your wine, and your oil, as well as the first of the fleece of your sheep, you shall give him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God has chosen Levi out of all your tribes to stand and minister in the name of the Lord, him and his sons for all time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a Levite leaves any of your towns, from wherever he has been residing in Israel, and comes to the place that the Lord will choose (and he may come whenever he wishes),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he may minister in the name of the Lord his God, like all his fellow-Levites who stand to minister there before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall have equal portions to eat, even though they have income from the sale of family possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you come into the land that the Lord your God is giving you, you must not learn to imitate the abhorrent practices of those nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall be found among you who makes a son or daughter pass through fire, or who practices divination, or is a soothsayer, or an augur, or a sorcerer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or one who casts spells, or who consults ghosts or spirits, or who seeks oracles from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does these things is abhorrent to the Lord; it is because of such abhorrent practices that the Lord your God is driving them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must remain completely loyal to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although these nations that you are about to dispossess do give heed to soothsayers and diviners, as for you, the Lord your God does not permit you to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people; you shall heed such a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you requested of the Lord your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly when you said, ‘Let me not hear again the voice of the Lord my God or see this great fire any more, lest I die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord replied to me, ‘They are right in what they have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their own people; I will put my words in the mouth of the prophet, who shall speak to them everything that I command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does not heed the words that the prophet shall speak in my name, I myself will hold accountable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But any prophet who presumes to speak in my name a word that I have not commanded the prophet to speak or who speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may say to yourself, ‘How can we recognize a word that the Lord has not spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a prophet speaks in the name of the Lord but the thing does not take place or prove true, it is a word that the Lord has not spoken. The prophet has spoken it presumptuously; do not be frightened by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Lord your God has cut off the nations whose land the Lord your God is giving you and you have dispossessed them and settled in their towns and in their houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall set apart three cities in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall calculate the distances and divide into three regions the land that the Lord your God gives you as a possession, so that any homicide can flee to one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is the case of a homicide who might flee there and live, that is, someone who has killed another person unintentionally when the two had not been at enmity before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose someone goes into the forest with another to cut wood, and when one of them swings the ax to cut down a tree, the head slips from the handle and strikes the other person, who then dies; the killer may flee to one of these cities and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the distance is too great, the avenger of blood in hot anger might pursue and overtake and put the killer to death, although a death sentence was not deserved, since the two had not been at enmity before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I command you: You shall set apart three cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as he swore to your ancestors—and he will give you all the land that he promised your ancestors to give you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: provided you diligently observe this entire commandment that I command you today, by loving the Lord your God and walking always in his ways—then you shall add three more cities to these three,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the blood of an innocent person may not be shed in the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, thereby bringing bloodguilt upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if someone at enmity with another lies in wait and attacks and takes the life of that person and flees into one of these cities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the elders of the killer’s city shall send to have the culprit taken from there and handed over to the avenger of blood to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show no pity; you shall purge the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, so that it may go well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not move your neighbor’s boundary marker, set up by former generations, on the property that will be allotted to you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A single witness shall not suffice to convict a person of any crime or wrongdoing in connection with any offense that may be committed. Only on the evidence of two or three witnesses shall a charge be sustained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a malicious witness comes forward to accuse someone of wrongdoing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then both parties to the dispute shall appear before the Lord, before the priests and the judges who are in office in those days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the judges shall make a thorough inquiry. If the witness is a false witness, having testified falsely against another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall do to the false witness just as the false witness had meant to do to the other. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest shall hear and be afraid, and a crime such as this shall never again be committed among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you go out to war against your enemies and see horses and chariots, an army larger than your own, do not fear them, for the Lord your God is with you, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before you engage in battle, the priest shall come forward and speak to the troops
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall say to them, ‘Hear, O Israel! Today you are drawing near to do battle against your enemies. Do not lose heart or be afraid or panic or be in dread of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is the Lord your God who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to give you victory.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers shall address the troops, saying, ‘Has anyone built a new house but not dedicated it? He should go back to his house, lest he die in the battle and another dedicate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has anyone planted a vineyard but not yet enjoyed its fruit? He should go back to his house, lest he die in the battle and another be first to enjoy its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has anyone become engaged to a woman but not yet married her? He should go back to his house, lest he die in the battle and another marry her.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers shall continue to address the troops, saying, ‘Is anyone afraid or disheartened? He should go back to his house, or he might cause the heart of his comrades to melt like his own.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officers have finished addressing the troops, then the commanders shall take charge of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you draw near to a town to fight against it, offer it terms of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it accepts your terms of peace and surrenders to you, then all the people in it shall serve you at forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it does not accept your terms of peace and makes war against you, then you shall besiege it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the Lord your God gives it into your hand, you shall put all its males to the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may, however, take as your plunder the women, the children, livestock, and everything else in the town, all its spoil. You may enjoy the spoil of your enemies, which the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall treat all the towns that are very far from you, which are not towns of these nations here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the towns of these peoples that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, you must not let anything that breathes remain alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, you shall annihilate them—the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites—just as the Lord your God has commanded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they may not teach you to do all the abhorrent things that they do for their gods and you thus sin against the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you besiege a town for a long time, making war against it in order to take it, you must not destroy its trees by wielding an ax against them. Although you may take food from them, you must not cut them down. Are trees in the field human beings that they should come under siege from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may destroy only the trees that you know do not produce food; you may cut them down for use in building siegeworks against the town that makes war with you, until it falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If, in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess, a body is found lying in open country, and it is not known who struck the person down,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then your elders and your judges shall come out to measure the distances to the towns that are near the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of the town nearest the body shall take a heifer that has never been worked, one that has not pulled in the yoke;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the elders of that town shall bring the heifer down to a wadi with running water, which is neither plowed nor sown, and shall break the heifer’s neck there in the wadi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come forward, for the Lord your God has chosen them to minister to him and to pronounce blessings in the name of the Lord, and by their decision all cases of dispute and assault shall be settled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the elders of that town nearest the body shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the wadi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall declare, ‘Our hands did not shed this blood, nor were we witnesses to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Absolve, O Lord, your people Israel, whom you redeemed; do not let the guilt of innocent blood remain in the midst of your people Israel.’ Then they will be absolved of bloodguilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall purge the guilt of innocent blood from your midst, because you must do what is right in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you go out to war against your enemies and the Lord your God hands them over to you and you take them captive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: suppose you see among the captives a beautiful woman whom you desire and want to marry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so you bring her home to your house: she shall shave her head, pare her nails,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: discard her captive’s garb, and remain in your house a full month mourning for her father and mother; after that you may go in to her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are not satisfied with her, you shall let her go free and certainly not sell her for money. You must not treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man has two wives, one of them loved and the other disliked, and if both the loved and the disliked have borne him sons, the firstborn being the son of the one who is disliked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then on the day when he wills his possessions to his sons, he is not permitted to treat the son of the loved as the firstborn in preference to the son of the disliked, who is the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must acknowledge as firstborn the son of the one who is disliked, giving him a double portion of all that he has; since he is the first issue of his virility, the right of the firstborn is his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If someone has a stubborn and rebellious son who will not obey his father and mother, who does not heed them when they discipline him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his father and his mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his town at the gate of that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall say to the elders of his town, ‘This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious. He will not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the men of the town shall stone him to death. So you shall purge the evil from your midst, and all Israel will hear and be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When someone is convicted of a crime punishable by death and is executed and you hang him on a tree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his corpse must not remain all night upon the tree; you must bury him that same day, for anyone hung on a tree is under God’s curse. You must not defile the land that the Lord your God is giving you for possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not watch your neighbor’s ox or sheep straying away and ignore them; you shall take them back to their owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the owner does not reside near you or you do not know who the owner is, you shall bring it to your own house, and it shall remain with you until the owner claims it; then you shall return it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do the same with a neighbor’s donkey; you shall do the same with a neighbor’s garment; and you shall do the same with anything else that your neighbor loses and you find. You may not withhold your help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not see your neighbor’s donkey or ox fallen on the road and ignore it; you shall help to lift it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A woman shall not wear a man’s apparel, nor shall a man put on a woman’s garment, for whoever does such things is abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you come on a bird’s nest, in any tree or on the ground, with fledglings or eggs, with the mother sitting on the fledglings or on the eggs, you shall not take the mother with the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the mother go, taking only the young for yourself, in order that it may go well with you and you may live long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you build a new house, you shall make a parapet for your roof; otherwise you might have bloodguilt on your house, if anyone should fall from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not sow your vineyard with two kinds of seed, or the whole yield will be forbidden, both the crop that you have sown and the yield of the vineyard itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not wear clothes made of wool and linen woven together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make tassels on the four corners of the cloak with which you cover yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose a man marries a woman but after going in to her dislikes her
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and makes up charges against her, slandering her by saying, ‘I married this woman, but when I lay with her, I did not find evidence of her virginity.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father of the young woman and her mother shall then submit the evidence of the young woman’s virginity to the elders of the city at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father of the young woman shall say to the elders: ‘I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he dislikes her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now he has made up charges against her, saying, “I did not find evidence of your daughter’s virginity.” But here is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity.’ Then they shall spread out the cloth before the elders of the town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of that town shall take the man and punish him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they shall fine him one hundred shekels of silver (which they shall give to the young woman’s father) because he has slandered a virgin of Israel. She shall remain his wife; he shall not be permitted to divorce her as long as he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If, however, this charge is true, that evidence of the young woman’s virginity was not found,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they shall bring the young woman out to the entrance of her father’s house, and the men of her town shall stone her to death, because she committed a disgraceful act in Israel by prostituting herself in her father’s house. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man is discovered lying with the wife of another man, both of them shall die, the man who lay with the woman as well as the woman. So you shall purge the evil from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If there is a young woman, a virgin already engaged to be married, and a man meets her in the town and lies with her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall bring both of them to the gate of that town and stone them to death, the young woman because she did not cry for help in the town and the man because he violated his neighbor’s wife. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the man meets the engaged woman in the open country and the man seizes her and lies with her, then only the man who lay with her shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do nothing to the young woman; the young woman has not committed an offense punishable by death, because this case is like that of someone who attacks and murders a neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he found her in the open country, the engaged woman may have cried for help, but there was no one to rescue her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man meets a virgin who is not engaged and seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the man who lay with her shall give fifty shekels of silver to the young woman’s father, and she shall become his wife. Because he violated her, he shall not be permitted to divorce her as long as he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A man shall not marry his father’s wife, thereby violating his father’s rights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one whose testicles are crushed or whose penis is cut off shall come into the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Those born of an illicit union shall not come into the assembly of the Lord. Even to the tenth generation, none of their descendants shall come into the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No Ammonite or Moabite shall come into the assembly of the Lord even to the tenth generation. None of their descendants shall come into the assembly of the Lord forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they did not meet you with food and water on your journey out of Egypt and because they hired against you Balaam son of Beor, from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Yet the Lord your God refused to heed Balaam; the Lord your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the Lord your God loved you.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall never promote their welfare or their prosperity as long as you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not abhor any of the Edomites, for they are your kin. You shall not abhor any of the Egyptians, because you were an alien residing in their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of the third generation that are born to them may come into the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are encamped against your enemies, you shall guard against every evil thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one of you becomes unclean because of a nocturnal emission, then he shall go outside the camp; he must not come within the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening comes, he shall wash himself with water, and when the sun has set, he may come back into the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall have a designated area outside the camp to which you shall go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With your tools you shall have a trowel; when you relieve yourself outside, you shall dig a hole with it and then cover up your excrement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Lord your God travels along with your camp, to save you and to hand over your enemies to you, therefore your camp must be holy, so that he may not see anything indecent among you and turn away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not return to their owners slaves who have escaped to you from their owners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall reside with you, in your midst, in any place they choose in any one of your towns, wherever they please; you shall not oppress them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “None of the daughters of Israel shall serve in an illicit shrine; none of the sons of Israel shall serve in an illicit shrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bring the fee of a prostitute or the wages of a dog into the house of the Lord your God in payment for any vow, for both of these are abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not charge interest on loans to another Israelite, interest on money, interest on provisions, interest on anything that is lent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On loans to a foreigner you may charge interest, but on loans to another Israelite you may not charge interest, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all your undertakings in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you make a vow to the Lord your God, do not postpone fulfilling it, for the Lord your God will surely require it of you, and you would incur guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you refrain from vowing, you will not incur guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever your lips utter you must diligently perform, just as you have freely vowed to the Lord your God with your own mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you go into your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat your fill of grapes, as many as you wish, but you shall not put any in a container.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you go into your neighbor’s standing grain, you may pluck the ears with your hand, but you shall not put a sickle to your neighbor’s standing grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose a man enters into marriage with a woman but she does not please him because he finds something objectionable about her, so he writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her out of his house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: she then leaves his house and goes off to become another man’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then suppose the second man dislikes her, writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her out of his house (or the second man who married her dies):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: her first husband, who sent her away, is not permitted to take her again to be his wife after she has been defiled, for that would be abhorrent to the Lord, and you shall not bring guilt on the land that the Lord your God is giving you as a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man is newly married, he shall not go out with the army or be charged with any related duty. He shall be free at home one year, to be happy with the wife whom he has married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one shall take a mill or an upper millstone in pledge, for that would be taking a life in pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If someone is caught kidnaping another Israelite, enslaving or selling the Israelite, then that kidnaper shall die. So you shall purge the evil from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Guard against an outbreak of a defiling skin disease by being very careful; you shall carefully observe whatever the Levitical priests instruct you, just as I have commanded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam on your journey out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you make your neighbor a loan of any kind, you shall not go into the house to take the pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall wait outside while the person to whom you are making the loan brings the pledge out to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is poor, you shall not sleep in the garment given you as the pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give the pledge back by sunset, so that your neighbor may sleep in the cloak and bless you, and it will be to your credit before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not withhold the wages of poor and needy laborers, whether other Israelites or aliens who reside in your land in one of your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall pay them their wages daily before sunset, because they are poor and their livelihood depends on them; otherwise they might cry to the Lord against you, and you would incur guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Parents shall not be put to death for their children, nor shall children be put to death for their parents; only for their own crimes may persons be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not deprive a resident alien or an orphan of justice; you shall not take a widow’s garment in pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you from there; therefore I command you to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you reap your harvest in your field and forget a sheaf in the field, you shall not go back to get it; it shall be left for the alien, the orphan, and the widow, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all your undertakings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you beat your olive trees, do not strip what is left; it shall be for the alien, the orphan, and the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, do not glean what is left; it shall be for the alien, the orphan, and the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore I am commanding you to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose two persons have a dispute and enter into litigation, and the judges decide between them, declaring one to be in the right and the other to be in the wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the one in the wrong deserves to be flogged, the judge shall make that person lie down and be beaten in his presence with the number of lashes proportionate to the offense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forty lashes may be given but not more; if more lashes than these are given, your neighbor will be degraded in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When brothers reside together and one of them dies and has no son, the wife of the deceased shall not be married outside the family to a stranger. Her husband’s brother shall go in to her, taking her in marriage and performing the duty of a husband’s brother to her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the firstborn whom she bears shall succeed to the name of the deceased brother, so that his name may not be blotted out of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man has no desire to marry his brother’s widow, then his brother’s widow shall go up to the elders at the gate and say, ‘My husband’s brother refuses to perpetuate his brother’s name in Israel; he will not perform the duty of a husband’s brother to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the elders of his town shall summon him and speak to him. If he persists, saying, ‘I have no desire to marry her,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his brother’s wife shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, pull his sandal off his foot, spit in his face, and declare, ‘This is what is done to the man who does not build up his brother’s house.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throughout Israel his family shall be known as ‘the house of him whose sandal was pulled off.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If men get into a fight with one another and the wife of one intervenes to rescue her husband from the grip of his opponent by reaching out and seizing his genitals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall cut off her hand; show no pity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not have in your bag two kinds of weights, large and small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have in your house two kinds of measures, large and small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have only a full and honest weight; you shall have only a full and honest measure, so that your days may be long in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all who do such things, all who act dishonestly, are abhorrent to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember what Amalek did to you on your journey out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he attacked you on the way, when you were faint and weary, and struck down all who lagged behind you; he did not fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when the Lord your God has given you rest from all your enemies on every hand, in the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess, you shall blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven; do not forget.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have come into the land that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess and you possess it and settle in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall take some of the first of all the fruit of the ground, which you harvest from the land that the Lord your God is giving you, and you shall put it in a basket and go to the place that the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall go to the priest who is in office at that time and say to him, ‘Today I declare to the Lord your God that I have come into the land that the Lord swore to our ancestors to give us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priest takes the basket from your hand and sets it down before the altar of the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall make this response before the Lord your God: ‘A wandering Aramean was my ancestor; he went down into Egypt and lived there as an alien, few in number, and there he became a great nation, mighty and populous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Egyptians treated us harshly and afflicted us, by imposing hard labor on us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we cried to the Lord, the God of our ancestors; the Lord heard our voice and saw our affliction, our toil, and our oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, with a terrifying display of power, and with signs and wonders;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he brought us into this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now I bring the first of the fruit of the ground that you, O Lord, have given me.’ You shall set it down before the Lord your God and bow down before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you, together with the Levites and the aliens who reside among you, shall celebrate with all the bounty that the Lord your God has given to you and to your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have finished paying all the tithe of your produce in the third year (which is the year of the tithe), giving it to the Levites, the aliens, the orphans, and the widows, so that they may eat their fill within your towns,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say before the Lord your God, ‘I have removed the sacred portion from the house, and I have given it to the Levites, the resident aliens, the orphans, and the widows, in accordance with your entire commandment that you commanded me; I have neither transgressed nor forgotten any of your commandments:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not eaten of it while in mourning; I have not removed any of it while I was unclean; and I have not offered any of it to the dead. I have obeyed the Lord my God, doing just as you commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look down from your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless your people Israel and the ground that you have given us, as you swore to our ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This very day the Lord your God is commanding you to observe these statutes and ordinances, so observe them diligently with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today you have obtained the Lord’s agreement: to be your God; and for you to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, his commandments, and his ordinances, and to obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today the Lord has obtained your agreement: to be his treasured people, as he promised you, and to keep all his commandments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for him to set you high above all nations that he has made, in praise and in fame and in honor; and for you to be a people holy to the Lord your God, as he promised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel charged all the people as follows: “Keep the entire commandment that I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day that you cross over the Jordan into the land that the Lord your God is giving you, you shall set up large stones and cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write on them all the words of this law when you have crossed over, to enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when you have crossed over the Jordan, you shall set up these stones about which I am commanding you today on Mount Ebal, and you shall cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall build an altar there to the Lord your God, an altar of stones on which you have not used an iron tool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must build the altar of the Lord your God of unhewn stones. Then offer up burnt offerings on it to the Lord your God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: make sacrifices of well-being, and eat them there, rejoicing before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write on the stones all the words of this law very clearly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying, “Keep silence and hear, O Israel! This very day you have become the people of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore obey the Lord your God, observing his commandments and his statutes that I am commanding you today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day Moses charged the people as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you have crossed over the Jordan, these shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these shall stand on Mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levites shall declare in a loud voice to all the Israelites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who makes an idol or casts an image, anything abhorrent to the Lord, the work of an artisan, and sets it up in secret.’ All the people shall respond, saying, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who dishonors father or mother.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who moves a neighbor’s boundary marker.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who misleads a blind person on the road.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who deprives an alien, an orphan, or a widow of justice.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who lies with his father’s wife, because he has violated his father’s rights.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who lies with any animal.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who lies with his sister, whether the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who lies with his mother-in-law.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who strikes down a neighbor in secret.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who takes a bribe to shed innocent blood.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “ ‘Cursed be anyone who does not uphold the words of this law by observing them.’ All the people shall say, ‘Amen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you will only obey the Lord your God, by diligently observing all his commandments that I am commanding you today, the Lord your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all these blessings shall come upon you and overtake you, if you obey the Lord your God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed shall you be in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed shall be the fruit of your womb, the fruit of your ground, and the fruit of your livestock, both the increase of your cattle and the issue of your flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Blessed shall you be when you come in, and blessed shall you be when you go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord will cause your enemies who rise against you to be defeated before you; they shall come out against you one way and flee before you seven ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will command the blessing upon you in your barns and in all that you undertake; he will bless you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will establish you as his holy people, as he has sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of the Lord your God and walk in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the peoples of the earth shall see that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they shall be afraid of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make you abound in prosperity, in the fruit of your womb, in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your ground in the land that the Lord swore to your ancestors to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will open for you his rich storehouse, the heavens, to give the rain of your land in its season and to bless all your undertakings. You will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make you the head and not the tail; you shall be only at the top and not at the bottom—if you obey the commandments of the Lord your God that I am commanding you today by diligently observing them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you do not turn aside from any of the words that I am commanding you today, either to the right or to the left, following other gods to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you will not obey the Lord your God by diligently observing all his commandments and decrees that I am commanding you today, then all these curses shall come upon you and overtake you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed shall you be in the city, and cursed shall you be in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed shall be the fruit of your womb, the fruit of your ground, the increase of your cattle and the issue of your flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed shall you be when you come in, and cursed shall you be when you go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord will send upon you disaster, panic, and frustration in everything you attempt to do, until you are destroyed and perish quickly, on account of the evil of your deeds with which you have forsaken me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make the pestilence cling to you until it has consumed you off the land that you are entering to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will afflict you with consumption, fever, inflammation, with fiery heat and drought, and with blight and mildew; they shall pursue you until you perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sky over your head shall be bronze and the earth under you iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will change the rain of your land into powder, and only dust shall come down upon you from the sky until you are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord will cause you to be defeated before your enemies; you shall go out against them one way and flee before them seven ways. You shall become an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your corpses shall be food for every bird of the air and animal of the earth, and there shall be no one to frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will afflict you with the boils of Egypt, with tumors, scurvy, and itch, of which you cannot be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will afflict you with madness, blindness, and confusion of mind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall grope about at noon as blind people grope in darkness, but you shall be unable to find your way, and you shall be continually abused and robbed, without anyone to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall become engaged to a woman, but another man shall lie with her. You shall build a house but not live in it. You shall plant a vineyard but not enjoy its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ox shall be butchered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it. Your donkey shall be stolen in front of you and shall not be restored to you. Your sheep shall be given to your enemies without anyone to help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your sons and daughters shall be given to another people while you look on; you will strain your eyes looking for them all day but be powerless to do anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A people whom you do not know shall eat up the fruit of your ground and of all your labors; you shall be continually abused and crushed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and driven mad by the sight that your eyes shall see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you on the knees and on the legs with grievous boils of which you cannot be healed, from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring you and the king whom you set over you to a nation that neither you nor your ancestors have known, where you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall become an object of horror, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples where the Lord will lead you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall carry much seed into the field but shall gather little in, for the locust shall consume it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall plant vineyards and dress them, but you shall neither drink the wine nor gather the grapes, for the worm shall eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have olive trees throughout all your territory, but you shall not anoint yourself with the oil, for your olives shall drop off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have sons and daughters, but they shall not remain yours, for they shall go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All your trees and the fruit of your ground the cicada shall take over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aliens residing among you shall ascend above you higher and higher, while you shall descend lower and lower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall lend to you, but you shall not lend to them; they shall be the head, and you shall be the tail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All these curses shall come upon you, pursuing and overtaking you until you are destroyed, because you did not obey the Lord your God by observing the commandments and the decrees that he commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be among you and your descendants as a sign and a portent forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because you did not serve the Lord your God joyfully and with gladness of heart for the abundance of everything,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore you shall serve your enemies whom the Lord will send against you, in hunger and thirst, in nakedness and lack of everything. He will put an iron yoke on your neck until he has destroyed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring a nation from far away, from the end of the earth, to swoop down on you like an eagle, a nation whose language you do not understand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a grim-faced nation showing no respect to the old or favor to the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall consume the fruit of your livestock and the fruit of your ground until you are destroyed, leaving you neither grain, wine, and oil nor the increase of your cattle and the issue of your flock, until it has made you perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall besiege you in all your towns until your high and fortified walls, in which you trusted, come down throughout your land; it shall besiege you in all your towns throughout the land that the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the desperate straits to which the enemy siege reduces you, you will eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of your own sons and daughters whom the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the most refined and gentle of men among you will begrudge food to his own brother, to the wife whom he embraces, and to the last of his remaining children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving to none of them any of the flesh of his children whom he is eating, because nothing else remains to him, in the desperate straits to which the enemy siege will reduce you in all your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She who is the most refined and gentle among you, so gentle and refined that she does not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground, will begrudge food to the husband whom she embraces, to her own son, and to her own daughter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: begrudging even the afterbirth that comes out from between her thighs and the children that she bears, because she is eating them in secret for lack of anything else, in the desperate straits to which the enemy siege will reduce you in your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you do not diligently observe all the words of this law that are written in this book, fearing this glorious and awesome name, the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will overwhelm both you and your offspring with severe and lasting afflictions and grievous and lasting maladies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bring back upon you all the diseases of Egypt, of which you were in dread, and they shall cling to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every other malady and affliction, even though not recorded in the book of this law, the Lord will inflict on you until you are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although once you were as numerous as the stars in heaven, you shall be left few in number because you did not obey the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as the Lord took delight in making you prosperous and numerous, so the Lord will take delight in bringing you to ruin and destruction; you shall be plucked off the land that you are entering to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will scatter you among all peoples, from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone, which neither you nor your ancestors have known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among those nations you shall find no ease, no resting place for the sole of your foot. There the Lord will give you a trembling heart, failing eyes, and a languishing spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your life shall hang in doubt before you; night and day you shall be in dread, with no assurance of your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning you shall say, ‘If only it were evening!’ and at evening you shall say, ‘If only it were morning!’—because of the dread that your heart shall feel and the sights that your eyes shall see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring you back in ships to Egypt, by a route that I promised you would never see again, and there you shall offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but there will be no buyer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words of the covenant that the Lord commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant that he had made with them at Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses summoned all Israel and said to them, “You have seen all that the Lord did before your eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his servants and to all his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great trials that your eyes saw, the signs, and those great wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to this day the Lord has not given you a mind to understand or eyes to see or ears to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have led you forty years in the wilderness. The clothes on your back have not worn out, and the sandals on your feet have not worn out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you have not eaten bread, and you have not drunk wine or strong drink—so that you may know that I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you came to this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out against us for battle, but we defeated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore observe the words of this covenant and perform them, in order that you may succeed in everything that you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You stand assembled today, all of you, before the Lord your God—the leaders of your tribes, your elders, and your officials, all the men of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your children, your women, and the aliens who are in your camp, both those who cut your wood and those who draw your water—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to enter into the covenant of the Lord your God, sworn by an oath, which the Lord your God is making with you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that he may establish you today as his people and that he may be your God, as he promised you and as he swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am making this covenant, sworn by an oath, not only with you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who stand here with us today before the Lord our God but also with those who are not here with us today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we came through the midst of the nations through which you passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen their detestable things, the filthy idols of wood and stone, of silver and gold, that were among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that there is among you a man or woman or a family or tribe whose heart is already turning away from the Lord our God to serve the gods of those nations. It may be that there is among you a root sprouting poisonous and bitter growth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who hear the words of this oath and bless themselves, thinking in their hearts, ‘We are safe even though we go our own stubborn ways’ (thus sweeping away the moist with the dry)—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord will be unwilling to pardon them, for then the Lord’s anger and passion will smoke against them. All the curses written in this book will descend on them, and the Lord will blot out their names from under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will single them out from all the tribes of Israel for calamity, in accordance with all the curses of the covenant written in this book of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next generation, your children who rise up after you, as well as the foreigner who comes from a distant country, will see the devastation of that land and the afflictions with which the Lord has afflicted it—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all its soil burned out by sulfur and salt, nothing planted, nothing sprouting, unable to support any vegetation, like the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the Lord destroyed in his fierce anger—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they and indeed all the nations will wonder, ‘Why has the Lord done thus to this land? What caused this great display of anger?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will conclude, ‘It is because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turned and served other gods, worshiping them, gods whom they had not known and whom he had not allotted to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the anger of the Lord was kindled against that land, bringing on it every curse written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord uprooted them from their land in anger, fury, and great wrath and cast them into another land, as is now the case.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the revealed things belong to us and to our children forever, to observe all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When all these things have happened to you, the blessings and the curses that I have set before you, if you call them to mind among all the nations where the Lord your God has driven you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and return to the Lord your God, and you and your children obey him with all your heart and with all your soul, just as I am commanding you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord your God will return you from your captivity and have compassion on you, gathering you again from all the peoples among whom the Lord your God has scattered you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if you are exiled to the ends of the world, from there the Lord your God will gather you, and from there he will take you back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will bring you into the land that your ancestors possessed, and you will possess it; he will make you more prosperous and numerous than your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, the Lord your God will circumcise your heart and the heart of your descendants, so that you will love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul, in order that you may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will put all these curses on your enemies and on the adversaries who took advantage of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall again obey the Lord, observing all his commandments that I am commanding you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord your God will make you abundantly prosperous in all your undertakings, in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your soil. For the Lord will again take delight in prospering you, just as he delighted in prospering your ancestors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when you obey the Lord your God by observing his commandments and decrees that are written in this book of the law, because you turn to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely, this commandment that I am commanding you today is not too hard for you, nor is it too far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not in heaven, that you should say, ‘Who will go up to heaven for us and get it for us so that we may hear it and observe it?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, ‘Who will cross to the other side of the sea for us and get it for us so that we may hear it and observe it?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, the word is very near to you; it is in your mouth and in your heart for you to observe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I have set before you today life and prosperity, death and adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you obey the commandments of the Lord your God that I am commanding you today, by loving the Lord your God, walking in his ways, and observing his commandments, decrees, and ordinances, then you shall live and become numerous, and the Lord your God will bless you in the land that you are entering to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if your heart turns away and you do not hear but are led astray to bow down to other gods and serve them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I declare to you today that you shall certainly perish; you shall not live long in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today that I have set before you life and death, blessings and curses. Choose life so that you and your descendants may live,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: loving the Lord your God, obeying him, and holding fast to him, for that means life to you and length of days, so that you may live in the land that the Lord swore to give to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses had finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to them, “I am now one hundred twenty years old. I am no longer able to get about, and the Lord has told me, ‘You shall not cross over this Jordan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God himself will cross over before you. He will destroy these nations before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua also will cross over before you, as the Lord promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will do to them as he did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land, when he destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will give them over to you, and you shall deal with them in full accord with the command that I have given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and bold; have no fear or dread of them, because it is the Lord your God who goes with you; he will not fail you or forsake you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses summoned Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel, “Be strong and bold, for you are the one who will go with this people into the land that the Lord has sworn to their ancestors to give them, and you will put them in possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the Lord who goes before you. He will be with you; he will not fail you or forsake you. Do not fear or be dismayed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded them, “Every seventh year, in the scheduled year of remission, during the Festival of Booths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when all Israel comes to appear before the Lord your God at the place that he will choose, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble the people—men, women, and children, as well as the aliens residing in your towns—so that they may hear and learn to fear the Lord your God and to observe diligently all the words of this law
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so that their children, who have not known it, may hear and learn to fear the Lord your God, as long as you live in the land that you are crossing over the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Your time to die is near; call Joshua and present yourselves in the tent of meeting, so that I may commission him.” So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud; the pillar of cloud stood at the entrance to the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Soon you will lie down with your ancestors. Then this people will begin to prostitute themselves to the foreign gods in their midst, the gods of the land into which they are going; they will forsake me, breaking my covenant that I have made with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My anger will be kindled against them on that day. I will forsake them and hide my face from them; they will become easy prey, and many terrible troubles will come upon them. On that day they will say, ‘Have not these troubles come upon us because our God is not in our midst?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will surely hide my face on account of all the evil they have done by turning to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, write this song, and teach it to the Israelites; put it in their mouths, in order that this song may be a witness for me against the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I have brought them into the land flowing with milk and honey, which I promised on oath to their ancestors, and they have eaten their fill and grown fat, they will turn to other gods and serve them, despising me and breaking my covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when many terrible troubles come upon them, this song will confront them as a witness because it will not be lost from the mouths of their descendants. For I know what they are inclined to do even now, before I have brought them into the land that I promised them on oath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very day Moses wrote this song and taught it to the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord commissioned Joshua son of Nun and said, “Be strong and bold, for you shall bring the Israelites into the land that I promised them; I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses had finished writing down in a book the words of this law to the very end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take this book of the law and put it beside the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God; let it remain there as a witness against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know well how rebellious and stubborn you are. If you already have been so rebellious toward the Lord while I am still alive among you, how much more after my death!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, so that I may recite these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that after my death you will surely act corruptly, turning aside from the way that I have commanded you. In time to come trouble will befall you, because you will do what is evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking him to anger through the work of your hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses recited the words of this song, to the very end, in the hearing of the whole assembly of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak;
    let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
