verses.text:
May my teaching drop like the rain,
    my speech condense like the dew,
like gentle rain on grass,
    like showers on new growth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will proclaim the name of the Lord,
    ascribe greatness to our God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Rock, his work is perfect,
    and all his ways are just.
A faithful God, without deceit,
    just and upright is he;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yet his degenerate children have dealt falsely with him,
    a perverse and crooked generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you thus repay the Lord,
    O foolish and senseless people?
Is not he your father who created you,
    who made you and established you?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When the Most High apportioned the nations,
    when he divided humankind,
he fixed the boundaries of the peoples
    according to the number of the gods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord’s own portion was his people,
    Jacob his allotted share.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sustained him in a desert land,
    in a howling wilderness waste;
he shielded him, cared for him,
    guarded him as the apple of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As an eagle stirs up its nest
    and hovers over its young,
as it spreads its wings, takes them up,
    and bears them aloft on its pinions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord alone guided him;
    no foreign god was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He set him atop the heights of the land
    and fed him with produce of the field;
he nursed him with honey from the crags,
    with oil from flinty rock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
curds from the herd, and milk from the flock,
    with fat of lambs and rams,
Bashan bulls and goats,
    together with the choicest wheat—
    you drank fine wine from the blood of grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jacob ate his fill;
    Jeshurun grew fat and kicked.
    You grew fat, bloated, and gorged!
He abandoned God who made him
    and scoffed at the Rock of his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made him jealous with strange gods;
    with abhorrent things they provoked him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed to demons, not God,
    to deities they had never known,
to new ones recently arrived,
    whom your ancestors had not feared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were unmindful of the Rock that bore you;
    you forgot the God who gave you birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord saw it and was jealous;
    he spurned his sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They made me jealous with what is no god,
    provoked me with their idols.
So I will make them jealous with what is no people,
    provoke them with a foolish nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a fire is kindled by my anger
    and burns to the depths of Sheol;
it devours the earth and its increase
    and sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will heap disasters upon them,
    spend my arrows against them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wasting hunger,
    burning consumption,
    bitter pestilence.
The teeth of beasts I will send against them,
    with venom of things crawling in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the street the sword shall bereave,
    and in the chambers terror
for young man and woman alike,
    nursing child and old gray head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “I will make an end of them
    and blot out the memory of them from humankind,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but I feared provocation by the enemy,
    for their adversaries might misunderstand
and say, “Our hand is triumphant;
    it was not the Lord who did all this.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are a nation void of sense;
    there is no understanding in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they were wise, they would understand this;
    they would discern what their end would be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How could one have routed a thousand
    and two put a myriad to flight,
unless their Rock had sold them,
    the Lord had given them up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, their rock is not like our Rock;
    our enemies are fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
their wine is the poison of serpents,
    the cruel venom of asps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not this laid up in store with me,
    sealed up in my treasuries,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, the Lord will vindicate his people,
    have compassion on his servants,
when he sees that their power is gone,
    neither bond nor free remaining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he will say, ‘Where are their gods,
    the rock in which they took refuge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who ate the fat of their sacrifices
    and drank the wine of their libations?
Let them rise up and help you;
    let them be your protection!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I lift up my hand to heaven
    and swear, As I live forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when I whet my flashing sword
    and my hand takes hold on judgment,
I will take vengeance on my adversaries
    and will repay those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
    and my sword shall devour flesh—
with the blood of the slain and the captives,
    from the long-haired enemy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Moses came and recited all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he and Joshua son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses had finished reciting all these words to all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to them, “Take to heart all the words that I am giving in witness against you today; give them as a command to your children, so that they may diligently observe all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is no trifling matter for you but rather your very life; through it you may live long in the land that you are crossing over the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that very day the Lord addressed Moses as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ascend this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab across from Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites for a possession;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall die there on the mountain that you ascend and shall be gathered to your kin, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his kin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because both of you broke faith with me among the Israelites at the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin, by failing to maintain my holiness among the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although you may view the land from a distance, you shall not enter it, the land that I am giving to the Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the Israelites before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said,
“The Lord came from Sinai
    and dawned from Seir upon us;
    he shone forth from Mount Paran.
With him were myriads of holy ones,
    at his right, a host of his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, O favorite among peoples,
    all his holy ones were in your charge;
they marched at your heels,
    accepted direction from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses charged us with the law
    as a possession for the assembly of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There arose a king in Jeshurun
    when the leaders of the people assembled,
    the united tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May Reuben live and not die out,
    even though his numbers are few.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And this he said of Judah,
“O Lord, give heed to Judah,
    and bring him to his people;
strengthen his hands for him,
    and be a help against his adversaries.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Levi he said,
“Give to Levi your Thummim
    and your Urim to your loyal one,
whom you tested at Massah,
    with whom you contended at the waters of Meribah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who said of his father and mother,
    ‘I regard them not’;
he ignored his kin
    and did not acknowledge his children.
For they observed your word
    and kept your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They teach Jacob your ordinances
    and Israel your law;
they place incense before you
    and whole burnt offerings on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless, O Lord, his substance,
    and accept the work of his hands;
crush the loins of his adversaries,
    of those who hate him, so that they do not rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Benjamin he said,
“The beloved of the Lord rests in safety—
the Most High surrounds him all day long—
    and he rests between his shoulders.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Joseph he said,
“Blessed by the Lord be his land,
    with the choice gifts of heaven above
    and of the deep that lies beneath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the choice fruits of the sun
    and the rich yield of the months,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the finest produce of the ancient mountains
    and the abundance of the everlasting hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with the choice gifts of the earth and its fullness
    and the favor of the one who dwells on Sinai.
Let these come on the head of Joseph,
    on the brow of the prince among his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And of Zebulun he said,
“Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out,
    and Issachar, in your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They call peoples to the mountain;
    there they offer the right sacrifices,
for they suck the affluence of the seas
    and the hidden treasures of the sand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Gad he said,
“Blessed be the enlargement of Gad!
    Like a lion he lives;
    he tears at arm and scalp.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And of Dan he said,
“Dan is a lion’s whelp
    that leaps forth from Bashan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Naphtali he said,
“O Naphtali, sated with favor,
    full of the blessing of the Lord,
    possess the west and the south.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And of Asher he said,
“Most blessed of sons be Asher;
    may he be the favorite of his brothers,
    and may he dip his foot in oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your bars are iron and bronze,
    and as your days, so is your strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is none like God, O Jeshurun,
    who rides through the heavens to your help,
    majestic through the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He subdues the ancient gods,
    shatters the forces of old;
he drove out the enemy before you
    and said, ‘Destroy!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Israel lives in safety,
    untroubled is Jacob’s abode
in a land of grain and wine,
    where the heavens drop down dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy are you, O Israel! Who is like you,
    a people saved by the Lord,
the shield of your help
    and the sword of your triumph!
Your enemies shall come fawning to you,
    but you shall tread on their backs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho, and the Lord showed him the whole land: Gilead as far as Dan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Western Sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Negeb, and the Plain—that is, the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees—as far as Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it with your eyes, but you shall not cross over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there in the land of Moab, at the Lord’s command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, opposite Beth-peor, but no one knows his burial place to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was one hundred twenty years old when he died; his sight was unimpaired, and his vigor had not abated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days; then the period of mourning for Moses was ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him, and the Israelites obeyed him, doing as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never since has there arisen a prophet in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord knew face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was unequaled for all the signs and wonders that the Lord sent him to perform in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants and his entire land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for all the mighty deeds and all the terrifying displays of power that Moses performed in the sight of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
